intro: Hieracium guttatifrons, commonly known as the spotted hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features bright yellow flower heads composed of numerous small florets, surrounded by greenish-brown bracts. Its leaves are typically heart-shaped with a rough texture and may bear white or yellow spots. Hieracium guttatifrons is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, and it can spread aggressively through rhizomes.
